questions.question: Q1. Bellman ford algorithm is used for determining

answers.a: Shortest path from all vertices to all other vertices
answers.b: Shortest path from a single source to all other vertices
answers.c: Shortest path from a single source to a single destination
answers.d: Shortest path from all vertices to a single destination

explanations.b: Bellman ford algorithm is used for determining the shortest path from a single source to all other vertices.

questions.question: Q2. We can use bellman ford algorithm to detect negative weight cycles in a graph.

explanations.a: Instead of running the algorithm for |V|-1 times, we can run it for |V| times. If the shortest distance of any vertex changes in the |V|th iteration, then it means that there is a negative weight cycle in the graph.

questions.question: Q3. The shortest distance between node 0 and 3 is :

explanations.b: The shortest diatnce between node 0 and 3 is 1 if we use the path 0->1->2->3

questions.question: Q4. The shortest distance between node 0 and 3 is :

explanations.d: Since there is a negative cycle 0->1->2->0, hence the solution does not exist.

questions.question: Q5. The cost of the longest shortest-path between Node 0 and some Node v in an undirected graph with all edge costs being 2 will never be more than(|E| is the total number of edges)

explanations.d: The maximum number of edges between node 0 and v will never exceed |v| - 1. Hence the cost of the longest shortest path will never exceed 2(|v| - 1).
